Title: LNG Canada begins startup phase with Train 1 cooldown; new gas flaring activity underway
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in Kitimat, British Columbia, has begun the cooldown of its first liquefaction train as of June 16, paving the way for the debut of Canada’s first LNG project and the start of exports.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies acquires offshore upstream assets in Malaysia
Description: TotalEnergies has acquired interests in multiple prospective blocks offshore Malaysia from Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas and inked a partnership agreement.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt's limited capacity casts doubt on Jordan's emergency gas relief
Description: Jordan’s state-owned National Electric Power Company (Nepco) has activated its emergency energy plan following the disruption of Israeli gas exports amid rising regional tensions.
Author: JS

Title: ADNOC’s XRG submits proposal to take over Australia’s Santos
Description: A consortium led by Abu Dhabi's state-owned energy firm ADNOC has made a $18.7 billion takeover bid for Australian Santos to build a leading integrated global gas and LNG business.
Author: JS

Title: Poland, Ukraine boost cross-border firm gas transmission capacity in July
Description: Ukraine’s gas transmission system operator and Poland’s Gaz-System have agreed to nearly double firm cross-border gas transmission capacity into Ukraine from Jul. 1 to 31, with hourly capacity rising from 2,827,500 kilowatt hour per hour (kWh/h) to 5,424,000 kWh/h.
Author: CK

Title: Italy’s Eni inaugurates Yasika hub to bolster Congo LNG exports
Description: Italy’s Eni has inaugurated its new Yasika logistics platform at Saipem’s yard in Pointe-Noire, Republic of the Congo, designed to underpin exports from its Congo LNG project and unlock the gas potential of the Marine XII permit.
Author: CK
